This discography contains information on all of Christopher Hogwood’s recordings that have been issued on LP, CD, VHS and DVD formats. Individual works are ordered alphabetically by composer.

1977
LP
Decca L’Oiseau-Lyre 6835 636

Minuet and 2 variations from Sonata No. 3 in G major only
Includes Presto from Overture No. 5 in D major, and extracts from Byrd’s My Lady Nevells Booke, Gibbons’ The Queen’s Command, Verse and Prelude, Purcell’s Suite from Abdelazer, Vivaldi’s Concerto in F major for flute Op. 10 No. 1 ‘La Tempesta di Mare’ RV433 and Cum dederit from Nisi Dominus RV608, Geminiani’s Sonata in B flat major for Cello Op. 5 No. 4 and Stamitz’ Presto from Symphony in D major Op. 3 No. 2
This compilation CD includes other works performed by other orchestras and soloists

Re-issued
2007
CD
Decca L’Oiseau-Lyre 475 9117 7
Harpsichord
Jacob Kirckman, London, 1766
Pitch
A=421
Comments
The original printed parts of Walsh’s edition (with the exception of the timpani part in Overture 7 which comes from the MS full-score in the British Museum, Add.11518), were used for this recording. Additional material (graces, continuo, cadenzas, etc.) was improvised in performance.
C P E Bach

2003
CD
Decca Club Dial 475 279-2

Includes Arne Sonata Nos. 1–8

Fortepiano
Adlam Burnett, after Heilmann, c. 1784
Pitch
A=422
Comments
The first English edition of c. 1781 by Welcker of London was used for this recording: ‘Four sonatas and two duets for the harpsichord or piano forte with an accompaniment for a German flute or violin.’

Includes works by Gibbons, C P E Bach and Arne
“Keyboard Music on authentic instruments”

Re-issued
2013
CD
Decca Australian Eloquence — 4805597 (2 discs)
[O] Organ
English c.1623, A=455
[H] Harpsichord
Italian, 16th century, A=415
[S] Spinet
Marco Jadra, Italian 1568, A=349
[V] Virginal
Thomas White, London 1642, A=440
Pitch
A=see individual instruments above
Comments
Composers known to have written certain works but whose names were omitted by the Fitzwilliam Virginal Book scribe, Francis Tregian the younger, are indicated in square brackets.
Specific recording locations are as follows:–
28 April, 1981:Organ — Knole House, Kent
11 May, 1981: Harpsichord — Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge
9 May, 1981: Spinet — Ham House, Surrey
7–8 May, 1981: Virginal — Ham House, Surrey

Harpsichord
Jacob Kirckmann, London, 1766
Comments
The original English edition of 1747 was used for this recording, with minor mistakes corrected and compared with the violin transcription of the same year. Both copies are in the British Library, London.

Messiah (highlights)
Comfort ye my people, Ev’ry valley shall be exalted...And the glory of the Lord
Behold, a virgin shall conceive...Oh thou that tellest good tidings
For unto us a child is born
And suddenly... Glory to God
Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion
Behold the lamb of God
He was despised
All we like sheep
Hallelujah
I know that my Redeemer liveth
The trumpet shall sound
Worthy is the Lamb
Amen

2005
CD
BBC BBCMM253

Although intended for release as part of the 'complete' series of Haydn Symphonies, this 1996 recording was not issued until May 2005 when it was included as the cover CD for that month's issue of BBC Music Magazine.

Haydn: symphonies
Haydn
Symphonies

Symphonies 1–75 and 107–8 originally comprised the first 10 volumes of an unfinished series of the complete symphonies, which was to run to 15 volumes.

Mozart: symphonies
Mozart
Symphonies

On their original release, the symphonies were organised by location of first performance, and released in seven volumes. For ease of reference, they are listed below by Köchel number (K¹ catalogue); click on the volume number for full details of each recording.

“The World of Catherine Bott”

Re-issued
2003
CD
Decca (The British Music Collection) 475 052-2

Awards
Ein Echo für Dresden, Ancient Music Award, 1996
Songs and airs
Hark! Hark! How all things
Crown the altar, deck the shrine
If music be the food of love
Not all my torments
The plaint, “O, O let me weep!”
I attempt from love’s sickness to fly in vain
Olinda in the shades unseen
Urge me no more
Bess of Bedlam
Lovely, lovely Albina
Sweeter than roses
Dear pretty youth
When first Amintas sued for a kiss
The cares of lovers
Ye gentle spirits of the air
